intro: Terminalia mariana, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a small evergreen tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and small, inconspicuous flowers. Terminalia mariana is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate salt spray.
